instruction: Fill a large pot with enough water to comfortably cover the fettuccine. Add a generous pinch of salt (or 1 tablespoon) and bring the water to a rolling boil over high heat.
If using, add a tablespoon of olive oil to the boiling water to prevent sticking (optional).
Carefully add the fettuccine to the boiling water. Use tongs to gently separate the strands if needed.
Stir the fettuccine occasionally to prevent sticking, especially during the first few minutes of cooking.
Cook the fettuccine according to the package instructions, typically for 8-12 minutes, or until al dente (slightly firm to the bite).
Reserve about 1/2 cup of the pasta water before draining.
Drain the fettuccine in a colander.
Immediately return the drained fettuccine to the pot and toss with your favorite sauce. Add a splash or two of reserved pasta water to create a smooth and saucy consistency (optional).
